column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The museum's website is impressively useful
column2: especially the comprehensive collections search tool.  I emailed them to ask about a favorite work of mine (an etching by Albrecht Durer) and why it had not been displayed for several years.  The reply was not only timely (within one business day)
column5: but delivered a gem of a suggestion:  apparently any visitor can arrange
column7: to view privately any of the 80
column8: 000 works in the print and drawing collection.
